metadata.court_name: HIGH COURT OF DELHI AT NEW DELHI
key_issues: Trade mark infringement is a key issue in the case, with the plaintiff alleging that the defendant's use of the mark "DROTAWAL" is identical to and/or deceptively similar to the plaintiff's registered trade mark "DROTIN/DROTIN M".
The plaintiff is seeking a permanent injunction to restrain the defendant from manufacturing, selling, and advertising medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations under the impugned trade marks.
The issue of passing off is also relevant, with the plaintiff alleging that the defendant's use of the impugned trade marks is likely to cause confusion or deception in the mind of the public.

Unfair competition and dilution of the plaintiff's trade mark are also key issues in the case, with the plaintiff alleging that the defendant's actions are likely to erode the distinctiveness of the plaintiff's trade mark.
The plaintiff is seeking an order for delivery up of all infringing packaging, labels, and other materials for destruction or erasure.
The issue of rendition of accounts and payment of profits illegally earned by the defendant is also relevant, with the plaintiff seeking a decree for an amount to be determined.
The plaintiff is seeking a decree for a specific amount of Rs. 2,00,50,000, which suggests that damages or compensation are also a key issue in the case.

The defendant's submission to suffer a decree in terms of prayers (i) and (ii) of the prayer clause indicates that the issue of liability has been conceded, and the only remaining issue is the extent of the relief to be granted.
The court's decision to decree the suit without trial, and the plaintiff's entitlement to a refund of court fees, are also key issues in the case.
metadata.decision_summary:
**Case Summary: Cedar Properties & Trading LLP vs. Innova Captab Ltd & Ors. (CS(COMM) 614/2021)**

**Background:**

The case involves a dispute between Cedar Properties & Trading LLP (the Plaintiffs) and Innova Captab Ltd & Ors. (the Defendants) regarding the infringement of the Plaintiffs' registered trade mark "DROTIN/DROTIN M" (Registration No. 732349). The Plaintiffs alleged that the Defendants were manufacturing, selling, and advertising medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations under the impugned trade mark "DROTAWAL", which is identical to and/or deceptively similar to the Plaintiffs' registered trade mark.

**Legal Issues:**

The primary issues in this case were:

1. Whether the Defendants' use of the trade mark "DROTAWAL" constitutes an infringement of the Plaintiffs' registered trade mark "DROTIN/DROTIN M".
2. Whether the Defendants' actions amount to passing off and unfair competition.
3. Whether the Plaintiffs are entitled to a decree for permanent injunction, delivery up of infringing materials, and rendition of accounts of profits earned by the Defendants.

**Arguments:**

The Plaintiffs argued that the Defendants' use of the trade mark "DROTAWAL" is likely to cause confusion or deception in the mind of the public, and that it infringes their registered trade mark. The Defendants, on the other hand, did not contest the allegations and instead submitted to a decree in terms of prayers (i) and (ii) of the prayer clause in the plaint.

**Court Findings:**

The High Court of Delhi, presided over by Hon'ble Mr. Justice C. Hari Shankar, noted that the Defendants had submitted to a decree in terms of prayers (i) and (ii) of the prayer clause in the plaint. As a result, the Court did not need to delve into the merits of the dispute.

**Decision:**

The Court decreed the suit in favor of the Plaintiffs in terms of prayer clauses (i) and (ii) of the prayer clause in the plaint, which are:

i) A decree for permanent injunction restraining the Defendants from manufacturing, selling, offering for sale, advertising, directly or indirectly dealing in medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations under the impugned trade mark "DROTAWAL" or any other mark that may be identical to and/or deceptively similar to the Plaintiffs' registered trade mark "DROTIN/DROTIN M".

ii) A decree for permanent injunction restraining the Defendants from manufacturing, selling, offering for sale, advertising, directly or indirectly dealing in medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations under the impugned trade mark "DROTAWAL" or any other mark that may be identical to and/or deceptively similar with the Plaintiffs' registered trade mark "DROTIN".

The Court also ordered the registry to draw up a decree sheet and noted that the Plaintiffs would be entitled to a refund of court fees, if any, deposited by them, as the suit was decreed without a trial.

**Conclusion:**

In this case, the Defendants' submission to a decree in terms of prayers (i) and (ii) of the prayer clause in the plaint led to a straightforward decision in favor of the Plaintiffs. The Court's decree effectively prevents the Defendants from using the trade mark "DROTAWAL" or any other mark that may infringe the Plaintiffs' registered trade mark "DROTIN/DROTIN M".

HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE C.HARI SHANKAR 
 
JUDGMENT(O R A L) 
% 
 
 
 
       09.12.2022 
 
1. 
The prayer clause in the present plaint, instituted by the plaintiff 
against the defendants, reads thus: 
 
“37. 
It is, therefore, respectfully prayed that this Hon'ble Court may 
be pleased to grant the following reliefs: 
 
i)  
A decree for permanent injunction restraining the 
Defendants, their servants, agents, assigns in business, its 
dealers, stockists etc. from manufacturing, selling, offering 
for sale, advertising, directly or indirectly dealing in 
medicinal and pharmaceutical/medicinal preparations under 
the impugned Trade Marks "DROTAWAL" or any other 
mark that may be identical to and/or deceptively similar to the 
Plaintiffs Trade Mark “DROTIN/DROTIN M” as is likely to 
cause confusion or deception or which is likely to have an 
association 
with 
the 
registered 
mark

to 
infringement of the Plaintiffs' registered trade mark No. 
732349;  
 
ii)  
A decree for permanent injunction restraining the 
Defendants, their servants, agents, assigns in business, its

                       Neutral Citation Number : 2022/DHC/005466 
 
CS(COMM) 614/2021                                                                                   Page 2 of 3 
 
dealers, stockists etc. from manufacturing, selling, offering 
for sale, advertising, directly or indirectly dealing in 
medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations under the 
impugned trademarks "DROTAWAL" or any other mark that 
may be identical to and/or deceptively similar with the 
Plaintiff's registered trade mark DROTIN, as may be likely to 
cause confusion or deception in the mind of the public in 
mistaking the Defendant's goods/business as and for those of 
the Plaintiffs amounting to infringement, passing off & unfair 
competition/dilution. 
 
iii)  
A decree for delivery up of all the infringing 
packaging, labels, blocks, dyes, articles etc. to an authorised 
representative of the Plaintiffs for destruction/erasure. 
 
iv)  
An order for rendition of accounts of profits 
illegally earned by the Defendant and a decree for an amount 
so found due; 
 
v)  
A decree of Rs. 2,00,50,000/-. 
 
vi)  
An order for costs in the proceedings; and 
 
vii) 
Any further order as this Hon'ble Court deems fit 
and proper in the facts and circumstances of this case.” 
 
 
2. 
On 1st September 2022, the learned Counsel for the defendants 
submitted under instructions that the defendants were ready to suffer a 
decree in terms of the prayers (i) and (ii) of the prayer clause in the 
plaint. 
 
3. 
As such, it is not necessary for this Court to enter into the merits of 
the dispute. 
 
4. 
The suit, accordingly, stands decreed in terms of prayer clauses (i)  
and (ii) in para 37 of the plaint reproduced hereinabove. 
 
Digitally Signed
By:KAMLA RAWAT
Signing Date:13.12.2022
16:46:47
Signature Not Verified

--- PAGE 3 ---
                       Neutral Citation Number : 2022/DHC/005466 
 
CS(COMM) 614/2021                                                                                   Page 3 of 3 
 
5. 
Let a decree sheet be drawn up by the registry. 
6. 
As the suit has been decreed without trial, the plaintiffs would be 
entitled to be refunded the Court fees, if any, deposited by them. 
 
 
C.HARI SHANKAR, J 
 
DECEMBER 9, 2022/AR

tree_structure.title: Case Header and Parties
tree_structure.summary:
According to the PDF document "50. Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors..pdf", a legal case is ongoing in the High Court of Delhi at New Delhi. The case details are as follows:

* Case Number: CS(COMM) 614/2021 and I.A. 15757/2021
* Neutral Citation Number: 2022/DHC/005466
* Parties involved:
	+ Plaintiffs: Cedar Properties & Trading LLP and others, represented by Ms. Yashmeet and Ms. Arushi Singh
	+ Defendants: Innova Captab Ltd and others, represented by Mr. Chander Shekhar Patney and Mr. K. D. Sharma
* Date of Judgment: 09.12.2022
* Judge: Hon'ble Mr. Justice C. Hari Shankar

The plaintiffs are seeking relief in the form of a permanent injunction to restrain the defendants from manufacturing, selling, and advertising medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations under the trade mark "DROTAWAL" or any other mark that may be identical to or deceptively similar to the plaintiffs' registered trade mark "DROTIN/DROTIN M" (No. 732349). 

The plaintiffs claim that the defendants' actions may cause confusion or deception and amount to infringement of their registered trade mark. The court has been asked to grant a decree for permanent injunction to protect the plaintiffs' trade mark rights. The document is digitally signed by Kamla Rawat on 13.12.2022. (Source: 50. Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors..pdf)

tree_structure.title: Facts and Arguments
tree_structure.summary:
According to the PDF document "50. Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors..pdf", a legal proceeding was held in the High Court of Delhi at New Delhi (CS(COMM) 614/2021 & I.A. 15757/2021). The plaintiffs, Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors., were represented by Ms. Yashmeet and Ms. Arushi Singh, while the defendants, Innova Captab Ltd & Ors., were represented by Mr. Chander Shekhar.

The plaintiffs sought relief against the defendants for infringement, passing off, and unfair competition regarding the trademark "DROTIN". The plaintiffs prayed for a decree to restrain the defendants from manufacturing, selling, or dealing in medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations under the impugned trademarks "DROTAWAL" or any similar mark. They also sought delivery up of infringing materials, rendition of accounts of profits, and a decree for an amount of Rs. 2,00,50,000.

On September 1, 2022, the defendants submitted that they were ready to suffer a decree in terms of prayers (i) and (ii) of the plaint. As a result, the court deemed it unnecessary to delve into the merits of the dispute. The suit was decreed in favor of the plaintiffs in terms of prayers (i) and (ii) on December 13, 2022. The court's decision was digitally signed by Kamla Rawat. The PDF document provides a detailed account of the legal proceedings, including the parties involved, dates, and amounts claimed. (Source: "50. Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors..pdf")

nodes.title: Page 2
nodes.summary:
According to page 2 of the PDF "50. Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors..pdf", the plaintiffs, Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors., are seeking relief against the defendants, Innova Captab Ltd & Ors., for trademark infringement, passing off, and unfair competition. The plaintiffs are seeking a decree to restrain the defendants from manufacturing, selling, or dealing in medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations under the trademark "DROTAWAL" or any similar mark. 

The defendants, through their counsel, submitted on September 1, 2022, that they were ready to suffer a decree in terms of prayers (i) and (ii) of the prayer clause. As a result, the court decreed the suit in terms of prayer clauses (i) and (ii) on December 13, 2022. The decree includes a restraining order against the defendants and an order for delivery up of infringing materials. (Source: "50. Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors..pdf", page 2)

tree_structure.title: Decision and Orders
tree_structure.summary:
According to the PDF document "50. Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors..pdf", a legal proceeding took place in the High Court of Delhi at New Delhi, with case number CS(COMM) 614/2021 and Neutral Citation Number: 2022/DHC/005466. The plaintiffs, Cedar Properties & Trading LLP and others, were represented by Ms. Yashmeet and Ms. Arushi Singh, while the defendants, Innova CapTab Ltd and others, were represented by Mr. Chander Shekhar.

The court, presided over by Justice C. Hari Shankar, made a decision on December 9, 2022. The suit was decreed without trial, and the court ordered that a decree sheet be drawn up by the registry. As a result, the plaintiffs are entitled to a refund of court fees, if any, that they had deposited.

The key dates mentioned in the document are December 9, 2022, when the decision was made, and December 13, 2022, when the document was digitally signed by Kamla Rawat. The document does not mention any specific amounts or detailed arguments, but it outlines the basic structure of the legal proceeding and the court's decision. The PDF source provides a brief overview of the case, highlighting the parties involved, the court's decision, and the subsequent orders. Overall, the document provides a concise summary of the legal proceeding, focusing on the key facts and decisions. (Source: 50. Cedar Properties & Trading LLP & Ors..pdf)
